page.title: 13Visitors to the Eryrys area.
page.content: This is a pleasant rural area of outstanding natural beauty, inviting to people wanting to get out into the country. The whole area is crossed by lanes, tracks and footpaths. There are several tracks through the woods on Nercwys Mountain. There are a few holiday cottages and also two small caravan sites for visitors. Off the Pant-du road near to Tir-y-coed woods is a hut used as accomodation by ramblers groups, particularly from the Merseyside area. Just to the north west of the block is Maeshafn Youth Hostel providing accomodation for 2000 visitors each year, some from abroad, some from Merseyside clubs, many visiting the block to walk and cycle and by car. Local people visit the area by car and to walk. The tracks are used by horse riders.
